meanings.definition: Declared in law unable to pay outstanding debts.
meanings.sent1: The bankrupt company had to close its doors.
meanings.sent2: After losing all his money, he felt bankrupt.
meanings.sent3: The bankrupt clown couldn't afford any new jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt bankrupt after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The bankrupt city skyline was a stark reminder of economic struggles.

meanings.definition: Completely lacking in a particular quality or value.
meanings.sent1: The soup tasted so bland, it was almost bankrupt of flavor.
meanings.sent2: The old car was bankrupt of any modern features.
meanings.sent3: His wardrobe was bankrupt of any colorful clothes.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house seemed bankrupt of life.
meanings.sent5: The desert was bankrupt of water, making survival difficult.

meanings.definition: To reduce to a state of financial ruin.
meanings.sent1: The economic crisis threatened to bankrupt many businesses.
meanings.sent2: She feared the lawsuit would bankrupt her family.
meanings.sent3: His reckless spending habits could bankrupt him in no time.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected medical bills could bankrupt them.
meanings.sent5: The flood could bankrupt the small town's resources.
